data.title: Find funding
data.meta_description: Browse AFA grants and other funding opportunities, and review guidelines.
data.text:
Browse AFA grants and other funding opportunities, and review guidelines.

Click an opportunity to read the program guidelines.

Apply to have your artwork become part of the Alberta Foundation for the Arts (AFA) Art Collection

This funding supports a professional development program delivered by Canadaâ€™s Music Incubator.

This funding subsidizes fees of Alberta artists that provide arts residency projects for grades K-12

Funding supporting the public presentation of professional artists by reimbursing a portion of fees.

Funding for not-for-profit community orgs that self-create and produce performing art productions.

Annual funding for not-for-profit community organizations that provide arts programs and services.

This opportunity awards up to $18,000 for a specific dance project.

This scholarship of $7,000 is awarded annually to a young Albertan writer.

This scholarship of $7,000 is awarded annually to a young Albertan film and video artist.

This opportunity awards up to $18,000 for a specific film and video project.

Funding of up to $18,000 to support a specific Indigenous arts project.

This funding supports one three-month residency at the International Studio & Curatorial Program.

This funding provides up to $18,000 for a specific literary arts project.

This funding provides up to $18,000 to support a specific music project.

Three-year funding to professional organizations that create and produce performing art productions.

Three-year funding for member-based orgs who provide educational, promotional, and advocacy services

Three-year funding for professional organizations to program and display exhibitions of visual arts.

This scholarship of $7,000 is awarded annually to a young Albertan performing artist.

This scholarship of $7,000 is awarded annually to a young Albertan visual artist.

This funding provides up to $18,000 to support a specific theatre and/or performance art project.
